info.title: Honcho API
info.summary: The Identity Layer for the Agentic World
info.description: Honcho is a platform for giving agents user-centric memory and social cognition

get.description:
Get an App by ID.

If app_id is provided as a query parameter, it uses that (must match JWT app_id).
Otherwise, it uses the app_id from the JWT token.

parameters.name: app_id

schema.description: App ID to retrieve. If not provided, uses JWT token
schema.title: App Id

parameters.description: App ID to retrieve. If not provided, uses JWT token

x-codeSamples.source:
import os
from honcho import Honcho

client = Honcho(
    api_key=os.environ.get("HONCHO_API_KEY"),  # This is the default and can be omitted
)
app = client.apps.get()
print(app.id)

import os
from honcho import Honcho

client = Honcho(
    api_key=os.environ.get("HONCHO_API_KEY"),  # This is the default and can be omitted
)
app = client.apps.create(
    name="x",
)
print(app.id)

parameters.name: reverse

schema.description: Whether to reverse the order of results
schema.title: Reverse

parameters.description: Whether to reverse the order of results

schema.description: Filtering and pagination options for the apps list

x-codeSamples.source:
import os
from honcho import Honcho

client = Honcho(
    api_key=os.environ.get("HONCHO_API_KEY"),  # This is the default and can be omitted
)
page = client.apps.list()
page = page.items[0]
print(page.id)

parameters.name: name

schema.description: Name of the app to retrieve
schema.title: Name

parameters.description: Name of the app to retrieve

x-codeSamples.source:
import os
from honcho import Honcho

client = Honcho(
    api_key=os.environ.get("HONCHO_API_KEY"),  # This is the default and can be omitted
)
app = client.apps.get_by_name(
    "name",
)
print(app.id)

parameters.name: name

schema.description: Name of the app to get or create
schema.title: Name

parameters.description: Name of the app to get or create

schema.description: ID of the app to update

from honcho import Honcho

client = Honcho(

import os
from honcho import Honcho

client = Honcho(
    api_key=os.environ.get("HONCHO_API_KEY"),  # This is the default and can be omitted
)
user = client.apps.users.create(
    app_id="app_id",
    name="x",
)
print(user.id)

get.description:
Get a User by ID

If user_id is provided as a query parameter, it uses that (must match JWT app_id).
Otherwise, it uses the user_id from the JWT token.

parameters.name: user_id

schema.description: User ID to retrieve. If not provided, users JWT token
schema.title: User Id

parameters.description: User ID to retrieve. If not provided, users JWT token

from honcho import Honcho

)
user = client.apps.users.get(
    app_id="app_id",
)
print(user.id)

x-codeSamples.source:
import os
from honcho import Honcho

client = Honcho(
    api_key=os.environ.get("HONCHO_API_KEY"),  # This is the default and can be omitted
)
user = client.apps.users.get_by_name(

)

get.description: Get a User or create a new one by the input name

parameters.name: name

schema.description: Name of the user to get or create
schema.title: Name

parameters.description: Name of the user to get or create

x-codeSamples.source:
import os
from honcho import Honcho

client = Honcho(
    api_key=os.environ.get("HONCHO_API_KEY"),  # This is the default and can be omitted
)
user = client.apps.users.get_or_create(
    name="name",
    app_id="app_id",
)
print(user.id)

get.description:
Get a specific session for a user.

If session_id is provided as a query parameter, it uses that (must match JWT session_id).
Otherwise, it uses the session_id from the JWT token.

parameters.name: session_id

schema.description: Session ID to retrieve. If not provided, uses JWT token
schema.title: Session Id

parameters.description: Session ID to retrieve. If not provided, uses JWT token

x-codeSamples.source:
import os
from honcho import Honcho

client = Honcho(
    api_key=os.environ.get("HONCHO_API_KEY"),  # This is the default and can be omitted
)
session = client.apps.users.sessions.get(
    user_id="user_id",
    app_id="app_id",
)
print(session.id)

post.description: Create a Session for a User

parameters.name: reverse

put.description: Update the metadata of a Session

parameters.name: session_id

schema.description: ID of the session to update
schema.title: Session Id

parameters.description: ID of the session to update

x-codeSamples.source:
import os
from honcho import Honcho

client = Honcho(
    api_key=os.environ.get("HONCHO_API_KEY"),  # This is the default and can be omitted
)
session = client.apps.users.sessions.update(
    session_id="session_id",
    app_id="app_id",
    user_id="user_id",
    metadata={
        "foo": "bar"
    },
)
print(session.id)

delete.description: Delete a session by marking it as inactive

parameters.name: session_id

schema.description: ID of the session to delete
schema.title: Session Id

parameters.description: ID of the session to delete

x-codeSamples.source:
import os
from honcho import Honcho

client = Honcho(
    api_key=os.environ.get("HONCHO_API_KEY"),  # This is the default and can be omitted
)
session = client.apps.users.sessions.delete(
    session_id="session_id",
    app_id="app_id",
    user_id="user_id",
)
print(session)

200.description: Response to a question informed by Honcho's User Representation

x-codeSamples.source:
import os
from honcho import Honcho

client = Honcho(
    api_key=os.environ.get("HONCHO_API_KEY"),  # This is the default and can be omitted
)
dialectic_response = client.apps.users.sessions.chat(
    session_id="session_id",
    app_id="app_id",
    user_id="user_id",
    queries="string",
)
print(dialectic_response.content)

get.description: Clone a session, optionally up to a specific message

parameters.name: session_id

schema.description: ID of the session to clone
schema.title: Session Id

parameters.description: ID of the session to clone

parameters.name: message_id

schema.description: Message ID to cut off the clone at
schema.title: Message Id

parameters.description: Message ID to cut off the clone at

x-codeSamples.source:
import os
from honcho import Honcho

client = Honcho(
    api_key=os.environ.get("HONCHO_API_KEY"),  # This is the default and can be omitted
)
session = client.apps.users.sessions.clone(
    session_id="session_id",
    app_id="app_id",
    user_id="user_id",
)
print(session.id)

post.description: Adds a message to a session

x-codeSamples.source:
import os
from honcho import Honcho

client = Honcho(
    api_key=os.environ.get("HONCHO_API_KEY"),  # This is the default and can be omitted
)
message = client.apps.users.sessions.messages.create(
    session_id="session_id",
    app_id="app_id",
    user_id="user_id",
    content="content",
    is_user=True,
)
print(message.id)

post.description: Bulk create messages for a session while maintaining order. Maximum 100 messages per batch.

schema.title: Response Create Batch Messages For Session V1 Apps  App Id  Users  User Id  Sessions  Session Id  Messages Batch Post

x-codeSamples.source:
import os
from honcho import Honcho

client = Honcho(
    api_key=os.environ.get("HONCHO_API_KEY"),  # This is the default and can be omitted
)
messages = client.apps.users.sessions.messages.batch(
    session_id="session_id",
    app_id="app_id",
    user_id="user_id",
    messages=[{
        "content": "content",
        "is_user": True,
    }],
)
print(messages)

post.description:
Create a new metamessage associated with a user.
Optionally link to a session and message by providing those IDs in the request body.

x-codeSamples.source:
import os
from honcho import Honcho

client = Honcho(
    api_key=os.environ.get("HONCHO_API_KEY"),  # This is the default and can be omitted
)
metamessage = client.apps.users.metamessages.create(
    user_id="user_id",
    app_id="app_id",
    content="content",
    metamessage_type="x",
)
print(metamessage.id)

post.description:
Get metamessages with flexible filtering.

- Filter by user only: No additional parameters needed
- Filter by session: Provide session_id
- Filter by message: Provide message_id (and session_id)
- Filter by type: Provide metamessage_type
- Filter by metadata: Provide filter object

parameters.name: reverse

schema.description: Whether to reverse the order of results
schema.title: Reverse

parameters.description: Whether to reverse the order of results

schema.description: Filtering options for the metamessages list

x-codeSamples.source:
import os
from honcho import Honcho

client = Honcho(
    api_key=os.environ.get("HONCHO_API_KEY"),  # This is the default and can be omitted
)
page = client.apps.users.metamessages.list(
    user_id="user_id",
    app_id="app_id",
)
page = page.items[0]
print(page.id)

get.description: Get a specific Metamessage by ID

get.description:
Get a specific collection for a user.

If collection_id is provided as a query parameter, it uses that (must match JWT collection_id).
Otherwise, it uses the collection_id from the JWT token.

parameters.name: collection_id

schema.description: Collection ID to retrieve. If not provided, uses JWT token
schema.title: Collection Id

parameters.description: Collection ID to retrieve. If not provided, uses JWT token

)
collection = client.apps.users.collections.get(
    user_id="user_id",
    app_id="app_id",
)
print(collection.id)

import os
from honcho import Honcho

client = Honcho(
    api_key=os.environ.get("HONCHO_API_KEY"),  # This is the default and can be omitted
)
collection = client.apps.users.collections.create(
    user_id="user_id",
    app_id="app_id",
    name="x",
)
print(collection.id)

MessageBatchCreate.title: MessageBatchCreate
MessageBatchCreate.description: Schema for batch message creation with a max of 100 messages
